creator: tfohrer@t-online.de
text:
CAUSE: 
 Using iterator for a Map that is changed by more than 1 thread  
  
STACKTRACE:   
  
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException    
        at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:750)    
        at java.util.HashMap$ValueIterator.next(HashMap.java:780)    
        at    
org.apache.jasper.compiler.JspRuntimeContext.checkCompile(JspRuntimeContext.java:308)    
        at    
org.apache.jasper.compiler.JspRuntimeContext.run(JspRuntimeContext.java:515)    
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)

creator: glenn@apache.org
text: I have also seen this happen several times on a heavily loaded tomcat.

creator: tfohrer@t-online.de
text: how can we remove it, simply?      possibly first time solutions:      1. big synchronize on map that holds the reference    2. synchronize and clone/copy map values .... ..

creator: glenn@apache.org
text:
I have committed a patch which should fix the thread synchronization bug which
caused the ConcurrentModificationException. Will be in the next release.
